abstract: Microsoft is releasing new image-matching software that promises to streamline and automate the difficult task of monitoring child pornography on the Internet.
snippet: Microsoft is releasing new image-matching software that promises to streamline and automate the difficult task of monitoring child pornography on the Internet.
lead_paragraph: The Internet is a hyper-efficient distribution channel for media of all kinds. So it is hardly surprising, even if disturbing, that the march of the Net has also brought “an explosion in the spread of child pornography,” as Ernie Allen, president of the National Center for Missing and Exploited Children, put it.

headline.main: Microsoft Tackles the Child Pornography Problem

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: National Center for Missing and Exploited Children

abstract: European regulators dropped their antitrust case against Microsoft on Wednesday after the company agreed to offer customers a choice of rival Web browsers.
snippet: European regulators dropped their antitrust case against Microsoft on Wednesday after the company agreed to offer customers a choice of rival Web browsers.
lead_paragraph: European regulators dropped their antitrust case against Microsoft on Wednesday after the company agreed to offer customers a choice of rival Web browsers. The settlement ends what could have been a second costly legal battle for the American software giant, The New York Times’s Kevin J. O’Brien reported.

headline.main: European Union Drops Microsoft Antitrust Case

abstract: As Google and Bing continue rising, Yahoo’s search business continues to deteriorate.
snippet: As Google and Bing continue rising, Yahoo’s search business continues to deteriorate.

headline.main: Google and Bing Keep Rising While Yahoo Drops Again
